data.title: Its time to talk about Zsa Zsa Gabor
data.meta_description:
I know. It is the elephant in the room that none of us want to discuss. 
The time has come. 

Look I would NEVER EVER wish harm on anyone. 
Slap a cop...
data.text:
SixPapaCharlie

May the force be with you

Joined

Aug 8, 2013

Messages

16,200

Display Name

Display name:

Sixer

Nov 24, 2015

#1

I know. It is the elephant in the room that none of us want to discuss.

The time has come.

Look I would NEVER EVER wish harm on anyone.

Slap a cop, Marry a prince, lose your money to Bernie Madoff, I still wish you the best.

But it is hard to over look when she makes headline news 6 times in one year (2010 I think) teetering on the edge of death, gets in a car wreck, loses a leg, has a stroke, almost bleeds out, gets rushed to the hospital over and over and each time I get a CNN alert stating she is in critical condition and I think "Whoa I thought she already died" She was administered last rites already.

It has not gone unnoticed that she is alive and turning 99 in a little over 2 months.

Honestly I hope she lives to be 200 hundred but it is not cool to keep playing the death card. Die or don't die but this "Hungarian-born American actress cries wolf" bit a few years back really left me annoyed.

I don't want her to die but I would prefer if she hadn't kept making the news for being all but dead and here, years later is fine and dandy.

I just feel like we have all been played a bit.

She is toying with our emotions ya know?

Also Aviation:

It has not gone unnoticed that she is alive and turning 99 in a little over 2 months.

Honestly I hope she lives to be 200 hundred but it is not cool to keep playing the death card. Die or don't die but this "Hungarian-born American actress cries wolf" bit a few years back really left me annoyed.

Also Aviation:

That is not Zsa Zsa Gabor in Green Acres. That was her younger sister, Eva Gabor who starred with Eddie Albert.

Eva has been dead for 20 years.

---------------------

Eva Gabor (February 11, 1919 â€“ July 4, 1995) was a Hungarian-born American socialite and actress. She was widely known for her role on the 1965 to 1971 television sitcom Green Acres as Lisa Douglas, the wife of Eddie Albert's character, Oliver Wendell Douglas. She voiced "Duchess" in the 1970 Disney film The Aristocats, and Miss Bianca in Disneyâ€™s The Rescuers and The Rescuers Down Under. Gabor was successful as an actress in film, on Broadway and on television. She was also a successful businessperson, marketing wigs, clothing, and beauty products. Her elder sisters, Zsa Zsa and Magda Gabor, were also actresses and socialites.

-----------------
